main event: Witnesses observed a bright object in the sky, later identified as Venus, during the morning of March 27, 1966.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 15 minutes and was reported by multiple witnesses, including law enforcement officers., One witness self-identified the object as Venus based on its brightness and position., A dispatcher noted that the object had a red tint and was bright white., The object appeared to sway and stop due to atmospheric illusions., The object was estimated to be about 2 miles away and observed at an altitude of 500-600 feet.
sighted object: a bright light identified as Venus
